meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your girl, here to give you the lowdown on Octopath Traveler II. Now, I know what you're thinking - "Why should I care about some Japanese RPG sequel?" Well, let me tell you, this game is no ordinary JRPG. It's like a warm hug for your nostalgia centers, with all the right ingredients mixed in.

First off, the combat system has gotten a serious upgrade. Gone are the days of tedious turn-based battles; instead, we've got fluid, action-packed sequences that'll keep you on your toes. And don't even get me started on those gorgeous visuals - it's like someone took all the prettiest anime girls and put them in one game.

Now, I know what some of my fellow critics are saying (hello there, GameSpot and Game Informer!). They're saying this game doesn't break new ground, that it's just more of the same. And you know what? They're right! But let's be real, who needs new when you can perfect something that already works?

I mean, have you played a JRPG where the story wasn't, well, somewhat meh? Octopath Traveler II is like the exception to that rule. The writing is top-notch, and I'm not just saying that because I'm biased towards cute anime boys.

Now, some of you might be thinking, "But what about Latent Abilities?" Don't worry, they're still there - and let me tell you, they can be pretty game-changing (pun intended). And hey, who doesn't love a good day/night cycle?

So, in conclusion, Octopath Traveler II is the perfect blend of old-school charm and new-school excitement. If you're a fan of JRPGs or just looking for a great game to play, this one's got your name on it.

Oh, and did I mention the music? It's like someone took all the best anime soundtracks and mashed them together into one glorious album. Hippo Penny out!
